entry.title: G/L Account Hierarchy - Only a small selection is selectable
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I have another question about G/L account hierarchies (Manage Global Hierarchies). When I want to add new G/L accounts, I only get a small choice of 41 G/L accounts in the selection. WHY???

There is no othe filter used. I use the standard YCOA which should have hundrets of accounts.

I have the same choice while trying to include GL accounts into a financial statement version created in the same app.

Thank You in advance for any hint!

Best regards 

Rado

entry.title: MANAGE SERVICE QUOTATION
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

What is the purpose of Manage Service Quotations when the service sales process can already be handled using Manage Sales Quotations? I would like to understand the specific functionalities, options, and use cases that differentiate Manage Service Quotations from Manage Sales Quotations.

Additionally, I have tested the process using Manage Service Quotations with a service material and customer. However, the system is throwing errors during processing, which can be seen in the attached image. Kindly review and advise on the possible cause and resolution.

Best regards,

Dinesh

entry.title: Billing Engine Configuration - Resource Allocation Based on Planned vs Actual Hours in Customer Proj
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I have a question regarding the Billing Engine configuration in SAP for Professional Services projects, specifically for Customer Projects.

Is it possible to configure the billing engine to use different data fields for billing calculations based on resource allocation?

Specifically, I'm wondering if we can use planned hours instead of actual hours as the basis for billing in customer projects.

Has anyone successfully configured this type of setup? If so, could you share:

- Which configuration settings need to be adjusted?

- Any limitations or considerations to be aware of?

- Best practices for this type of configuration?

Any guidance or documentation references would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance for your help!

Best regards

entry.title: Local Ledger Accounting Principle
entry.content:
Hello,
We have the following situation, a group has the global accounting principle of UGB in group ledger. For one company code, the Local Ledger Accounting Principle should also be UGB. But UGB can not be assigned as it is already in the group ledger. What is the correct setting: Assign no accounting principle to the local ledger, or select a random placeholder accountin principle?
Best regards
Anja

entry.title: Project Budget Report Is not Working Properly
entry.content:
Budget Profile: PS001
I have used Budget Profile PS001 with Account Assignment Category P (0010000071) for WBS AUT-0923-012-01-01, as I have created and posted the PR accordingly.
After creating the PR, I observed that no commitment is reflected in the Project Cost/Budget Report.
The PO 4500000086 has been created as I have created and posted the PO; however, in the Project Financial Booklet ‚Äì Enterprise Projects, the commitment value is still showing as zero.
Additionally, in the Enterprise Project Budget Commitment Query, the commitment is also reflected as zero.
For the same WBS or for a different WBS with Account Assignment Category Q, the system is throwing a budget exceed error, even though no commitment is visible in the reports, as I have created and posted the transactions correctly.

Budget Profile: PSQ01
I have used Budget Profile PSQ01 with Account Assignment Category P (0010000072) for WBS AUT-0923-013-01-01, as I have created and posted the PR.
After PR creation, no commitment is reflected in the Project Cost/Budget Report, even though the PR has been created and posted.
The PO 4500000087 has been created as I have created and posted the PO; however, the Project Financial Booklet ‚Äì Enterprise Projects continues to show the commitment as zero.
Similarly, in the Enterprise Project Budget Commitment Query, the value is also showing as zero.
For the same WBS or a different WBS (0010000073), the Cost Report shows WBS 0010000074 with a total value of INR 659.94, whereas in the Project Financial Booklet, the amount is reflected as double, i.e., INR 1,319.88, as I have created and posted the transactions only once.

entry.title: Accessing Loading step for Outbound Delivery flow in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
entry.content:
We are working on S/4HANA Cloud Starter System (EWM ‚Äì Public Cloud).
Outbound delivery processing is available and preconfigured for Packing and Goods Issue.

However, we are facing an issue with the Loading step in the outbound flow.

Expected Process Flow:
OBD ‚Üí Picking ‚Üí Packing ‚Üí Loading ‚Üí Goods Issue
(Picking and Loading to be executed via RF Device)

Issue Observed:

  • Outbound Delivery is created and distributed to EWM successfully

  • Picking and Packing are available

  • Loading step is not triggered / not accessible

  • RF-based Loading is not determined

  • Goods Issue can be posted without explicit Loading


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: RAP Fiori Elements List Report Page with Analytical Table - How to?
entry.content:
Hi community,

I‚Äôm currently trying to implement a Fiori Elements List Report based on RAP and OData V4 and I‚Äôm struggling to align the current technical limitations with what is announced on the SAP roadmap.

My requirement

I need a generated Fiori Elements application that provides:

  • a List Report
    • using an Analytical Table
    • showing totals and subtotals for measures (amounts / quantities with currency or unit)
    • while still allowing create / update operations on the underlying business data via RAP

In other words:
üëâAggregations (totals/subtotals) and editability in the same List Page.

Roadmap reference

According to the SAP Roadmap (Q3 2025):

Support for analytical tables
Use analytical tables to provide users with totals and subtotals in applications
Feature is delivered as described in the documentation: Tables ‚Äì SAPUI5 SDK

Based on this roadmap entry, I would assume that using an AnalyticalTable in a Fiori Elements List Report is now intended to be a supported and productive option.

What I experience in practice

  • When using a transactional RAP BO (provider contract transactional_query) as the data source:
    • editing works as expected
    • but configuring the table as AnalyticalTable leads to aggregation-related errors
      (e.g. ‚ÄúAggregation not supported for this entity type‚Äù or
      ‚ÄúProperty ‚ÄòCurrency‚Äô is not flagged as custom aggregate‚Äù)
    • When switching to an analytical query view (@analytics.query: trueüòû
      • totals and subtotals work
      • but the entity becomes read-only, so editing is no longer possible
    • The Annotations @odata.applySupportedForAggregation: #FULL
      (mentioned in this scenario) is not permitted in RAP CDS view entities.

My open questions

  1. With the roadmap item marked as delivered:
    1. is it now officially supported to use an Analytical Table in a Fiori Elements List Report on top of a transactional RAP BO?
  2. If yes: what is the recommended architecture?
    1. a single transactional RAP BO with analytical capabilities?

    2. or still a separation between analytical (read-only) and transactional entities?

  3. If not: does the roadmap item only refer to UI5 analytical tables in general, but not to RAP-based, editable Fiori Elements List Reports yet?

Any clarification on the intended usage and current limitations would be highly appreciated.

Thanks a lot in advance and best regards;
Sarah
